body:

name: v0.4.6
body:
## What's Changed
* tests: disable running tests in parallel in Travis CI by @charlievieth in https://github.com/lyft/gostats/pull/109
* Do flush 0-valued counters by @haltwise in https://github.com/lyft/gostats/pull/108
* Remove remaining Glide bits by @ameliariely in https://github.com/lyft/gostats/pull/110
* Add GitHub actions instant-failure by @keith in https://github.com/lyft/gostats/pull/113
* Migrate to GHA by @fsouza in https://github.com/lyft/gostats/pull/114
* Bump github.com/sirupsen/logrus from 1.0.6 to 1.8.1 by @dependabot in https://github.com/lyft/gostats/pull/115
* Bump actions/checkout from 2.3.4 to 2.3.5 by @dependabot in https://github.com/lyft/gostats/pull/116
* Bump actions/checkout from 2.3.5 to 2.4.0 by @dependabot in https://github.com/lyft/gostats/pull/117
* Bump actions/setup-go from 2.1.4 to 2.1.5 by @dependabot in https://github.com/lyft/gostats/pull/118
* Gauges in the mock sink should store the value not add to it by @almost in https://github.com/lyft/gostats/pull/111
* Bump actions/setup-go from 2.1.5 to 2.2.0 by @dependabot in https://github.com/lyft/gostats/pull/121
* Retry failed writes once by @danielmmetz in https://github.com/lyft/gostats/pull/120

## New Contributors
* @ameliariely made their first contribution in https://github.com/lyft/gostats/pull/110
* @keith made their first contribution in https://github.com/lyft/gostats/pull/113
* @fsouza made their first contribution in https://github.com/lyft/gostats/pull/114
* @dependabot made their first contribution in https://github.com/lyft/gostats/pull/115
* @almost made their first contribution in https://github.com/lyft/gostats/pull/111

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/lyft/gostats/compare/v0.4.5...v0.4.6

name: v0.4.5: mock: Additional output details on assertion failures
body:
`v0.4.5`

* #105 List the names of all recorded metrics in the failure message for assertions that fail due to an expected metric not being found, so that you can easily compare the expected metric name to the actually-generated metric name.

name: v0.4.4: mock: add ParseTags() and SerializeTags() helper functions
body:
`v0.4.4`
* https://github.com/lyft/gostats/pull/103: tags: move tags logic to internal pkg and add [`ParseTags()`](https://godoc.org/github.com/lyft/gostats/mock#ParseTags) and [`SerializeTags()`](https://godoc.org/github.com/lyft/gostats/mock#SerializeTags) helpers

Example of usage of [`SerializeTags()`](https://godoc.org/github.com/lyft/gostats/mock#SerializeTags):
```go
tags := map[string]string{
	"key_1": "val_1",
	"key_2": "val_2",
}
counter := store.NewCounterWithTags("counter", tags)
counter.Add(2)

store.Flush()

n := sink.Counter(mock.SerializeTags("counter", tags))
fmt.Println("counter:", n, n == 2)
```

name: v0.4.3: never modify the provided tags map
body:
`v0.4.3`
* https://github.com/lyft/gostats/pull/101: tags: change serializeTags to never modify the tags map

name: mock: add Counters, Gauges and Timers methods to get a map of all stats
body:
`v0.4.2`

* https://github.com/lyft/gostats/pull/90: mock: add Counters, Gauges and Timers methods to get a map of all stats

name: Improve subscope performance and don't modify tag maps
body:
`v0.4.1`

* https://github.com/lyft/gostats/pull/97: Improves the performance of subscope operations and changes the code to not modify any of the passed in tag maps. Previously, `gostats` owned any tag map that was passed in, but this could lead to races if the same tag map was used to create two subscopes.

name: Add support for disabling logging sink when StatsD is disabled
body: - Users can optionally use a `NullSink` when StatsD is not enabled, this helps reduce debug log noise when users do not need to explicitly debug stats events (https://github.com/lyft/gostats/pull/94)

name: Add support for UDP sinks
body:
`v0.3.10`

* Add UDP as a sink protocol: https://github.com/lyft/gostats/pull/95

name: Fix bug where Flush() could hang if TCP Sink was reconnecting
body:
`v0.3.9`

* tcp_sink: don't hang on flush if reconnecting: https://github.com/lyft/gostats/pull/92

name: Don't use envconfig to parse settings
body:
`v0.3.8`

This release removes `github.com/kelseyhightower/envconfig` and fixes a bug in the last `v0.3.8` release that resulted in `Settings.UseStatsd` defaulting to false (it should default to true).

* settings: set DefaultUseStatsd to true: https://github.com/lyft/gostats/pull/89
* settings: remove envconfig: https://github.com/lyft/gostats/pull/88

Hat tip to @chenleiwhu for discovering this bug.

name: BUGFIX: Prevent bug causing metrics counter/gauge metrics to stop flushing.
Change buffering to not write partial stats
body:
`v0.3.3`

This release changes the buffering logic to prevent the writing of partial stats: https://github.com/lyft/gostats/pull/81

name: Prevent the TCP sink from blocking on Flush()
body:
`v0.3.2`

This release fixes a bug with the tcpStatsdSink that would lead to .Flush() blocking indefinitely if there was nothing to flush. It additionally, improves the reliability of the tcpStatsdSink by ensuring that establishing and writing to its net.Conn never blocks.

* https://github.com/lyft/gostats/pull/79

name: Drop under-defined tag pairs
body: This release adds filtering out tag pairs when the tag itself or the tag value is an empty string.

name: Remove expvars and metric publishing
body:
`v0.3.0`

**PR:** https://github.com/lyft/gostats/pull/76

This release removes the ability to publish stats via `expvars` and is technically a breaking change as stats are no longer published with `expvars.Publish()`.  There are no changes to the package API, but the `export` argument to `NewStore(sink Sink, export bool)` is now ignored.

We are removing `expvars` because is detrimentally impacts security, performance and reliability.

- **Security:** `expvars` makes the running programs command line arguments available at `/debug/vars`.  Note: passing sensitive information via command line arguments is a bad idea in general.
- **Performance:** `expvars` is meant to be called _only_ from `init()` functions and re-sorts its vars each time a new one is added.  This obviously becomes very expensive when a large number of stats are stored.
- **Reliability:** Again, `expvars` is meant to be called _only_ from `init()` and will panic with `log.Panicln()` if a duplicate var name is published.  This is hard to guard against: checking for duplicate var names before the call to publish can't protect against vars published by another package; and catching the panic with `recover()` still leads to erroneous messages written to STDERR (and changing the default output of `"log"` would be unacceptable side-effect).

Basically, we've been using `expvars` incorrectly and the best solution is to remove it.  If this breaks you, please reach out to us or file an issue and we'll work on a solution.

name: Recover expvar panic
body:
`v0.2.22`

Recover duplicate key panics from [`expvar.Publish()`](https://golang.org/pkg/expvar/#Publish) instead of guarding against duplicate keys with a `sync.Map`.  The `sync.Map` cannot prevent other packages from creating duplicate keys and increases memory usage.

* stats: recover expvar panic: https://github.com/lyft/gostats/pull/74

name: Improve performance of tag merging and printing
body:
`v0.2.21`

This release improves the performance of flushing stats and merging tags:
* tcp_sink: Improve the performance of flushing stats: https://github.com/lyft/gostats/pull/71
* tags: Aggressively inline tag serialization small tag sets: https://github.com/lyft/gostats/pull/72

name: Support Go 1.12 and fix bug in mock.Fatal() helper
body:
`v0.2.20`

* mock: panic when the type of testing.TB is not known and fix lint errors (https://github.com/lyft/gostats/pull/69)
* Go 1.12 Update (https://github.com/lyft/gostats/pull/70)

name: Add thread-safe mock sink for testing
body:
`v0.2.19`

* Add thread-safe mock sink for testing (https://github.com/lyft/gostats/pull/68)

name: Improve performance and reduce allocs
body:
`v0.2.18`

* tags: improve performance for small tag sets (https://github.com/lyft/gostats/pull/66)
* stats: use sync.Map instead of map + mutex (https://github.com/lyft/gostats/pull/67)

name: Fix race conditions
body:
`v0.2.17`

* Fix race conditions in [`NewCounterWithTags`](https://github.com/lyft/gostats/blob/afd370d7f261dbe258692f711edf5fe5940a9211/stats.go#L383) and [`NewCounterWithTags`](https://github.com/lyft/gostats/blob/afd370d7f261dbe258692f711edf5fe5940a9211/stats.go#L465)
* Fix panic when duplicate names were registered with [`expvar.Publish`](https://golang.org/pkg/expvar/#Publish) by preventing the registration of duplicate names

name: Improve performance and reduce allocs
body:
* Improve the performance of New* methods and tcpStatsdSink #50 
* Scope: remove fmt.Sprintf() string concatenation and improve tag merge #61

Benchmark Results (7054f867..bade9ed8 benchmarks backported to 7054f867):
```
benchmark                               old ns/op     new ns/op     delta
BenchmarkStore_MutexContention-8        251           112           -55.38%
BenchmarkStore_NewCounterWithTags-8     2710          489           -81.96%
BenchmarkStore_ScopeWithTags-8          6041          1389          -77.01%
BenchmarkStore_ScopeNoTags-8            3347          556           -83.39%
BenchmarkSerializeTags-8                2513          456           -81.85%

benchmark                               old allocs     new allocs     delta
BenchmarkStore_MutexContention-8        2              0              -100.00%
BenchmarkStore_NewCounterWithTags-8     32             3              -90.62%
BenchmarkStore_ScopeWithTags-8          61             4              -93.44%
BenchmarkStore_ScopeNoTags-8            37             4              -89.19%
BenchmarkSerializeTags-8                30             3              -90.00%

benchmark                               old bytes     new bytes     delta
BenchmarkStore_MutexContention-8        22            2             -90.91%
BenchmarkStore_NewCounterWithTags-8     800           272           -66.00%
BenchmarkStore_ScopeWithTags-8          1648          544           -66.99%
BenchmarkStore_ScopeNoTags-8            1200          304           -74.67%
BenchmarkSerializeTags-8                768           272           -64.58%
```

name: scopes: fix bug with tag inheritance.
body: * scopes: fix bug with tag inheritance. (#45)

name: Replace Periods in Tag Values
body: This release replaces periods in tag values with underscores to mimic `python-lyft-stats` behavior and to prevent malformed metric names / tags. `wavefrontproxy` expects there to be no periods in the tag value.

name: Tag improvements
body:
This release adds validation to tag values to defend unsanitized input from creating malformed statsd output, and defines a new `ScopeWithTags()` method to add default tags to a scope that are inherited that scope's child scopes and metrics.

Commits:

* scope: add ScopeWithTags() method. (@diegs #43) 
* tags: validate tag values. (@diegs #42)

name: Store.Flush() blocks until actual flush
body: see https://github.com/lyft/gostats/pull/40

name: Add counter names to log messages.
body: * tcp_sink: add counter names to log messages @diegs (#30)

name: Fixing Race Condition in NewCounter
body: Fixing race condition with publish. If two threads try to create the same counter they can both try and export the same variable. Doing this causes the second thread to panic.
